column4: If I need some help building a program from source (in ubuntu), where do I go for help?
right here might work.. just ask your question
Building the prog gives an error and I want to check if I have the right dependencies. How would I do that?
well.. you look at the error message from ./configure and make some kind of guess
if the program is available you can run sudo apt-get build-dep <packagename> to make apt install all dependencies for you
ok, thnx!
I dl'ed the src from svn. INSTALL said to run ./configure but that isn't present so I ran 'autoconf'. This gives errors about "possibly undefined marcos"
(also ran apt-get build-dep)
there's supposed to be a file called configure somewhere in there
check if it isn't in a subfolder or something
It's not in any subdir... I'll re-checout the entire tree
I just downloaded the source to gthumb and there is a configure script in the root folder of the source archive
are you sure you got all the files when you downloaded your source?
is it "configure.in" ?
nope.. just "configure"
I cheked it out from the svn repository. Maybe I should just download the source..
do that.. perhaps the svn is temporarily broken or something
did you apt-get the source or did yout firefox-get the source?
I downloaded it from the gthumb site
Thanks for the hlep
you're welcome
